capstone.utility

Class Delta

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.utility.AbstractPair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
      • capstone.utility.Delta
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Delta>

    public class Delta
extends AbstractPair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer>
implements java.lang.Comparable<Delta>
    A class to model a Delta to a point.

      • Delta

        public Delta(int x,
             int y)
        Constructs a new Delta given the delta-x and delta-y.
        Parameters:
        x - The delta for the x-component.
        y - The delta for the y-component.

    • Method Detail

      • Up

        public static Delta Up()
        Factory-function to create an upward Delta.
        Returns:
        A Delta for one position above.

      • Down

        public static Delta Down()
        Factory-function to create a downward Delta.
        Returns:
        A Delta for one position below.

      • Left

        public static Delta Left()
        Factory-function to create a leftward Delta.
        Returns:
        A Delta for one position to the left.

      • Right

        public static Delta Right()
        Factory-function to create a rightward Delta.
        Returns:
        A Delta for one position to the right.

      • Stay

        public static Delta Stay()
        Factory-function to create the Delta to stay, i.e. no change in position.
        Returns:
        A Delta for staying on the same point.

      • x

        public int x()
        Returns:
        The x-component of the Delta.

      • x

        public void x(int x)
        Sets the x-component of the Delta.
        Parameters:
        x - The new x-component for the Delta.

      • y

        public int y()
        Returns:
        The y-component of the Delta.

      • y

        public void y(int y)
        Sets the y-component of the Delta.
        Parameters:
        y - The new y-component for the Delta.

      • euclidian

        public double euclidian()
        Returns:
        The Euclidian-distance of the delta, i.e. the root of the sum of the squares of the Delta's components.

      • manhattan

        public int manhattan()
        Returns:
        The Manhattan-distance of the Delta, i.e. the sum of its components.

      • invert

        public Delta invert()
        Returns:
        A new Delta that is the inverse of this Delta, i.e. with the components negated.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Delta other)
        Compares two Deltas by their Manhattan-distance. Manhattan-distance because it's cheaper to compute.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Delta>
        Parameters:
        other - The other Delta to compare this one with.
        Returns:
        +1 if the Manhattan-distance of this Delta is greater than that of the other Delta, -1 if it is less and else 0.

      • _invalidate

        private void _invalidate()
        Invalidates the cached distances.
